00100 void sleep(unsigned int ms) {
00101    clock_t target = ms + clock();
00102    while (target > clock());
00103 }
00104 #endif /*WIN32*/

00117 char *Util::cloneString(const char *s) {
00118   char *copy = NULL;
00119   if(s == NULL)
00120     return NULL;
00121 
00122   size_t length = strlen(s);
00123   //  copy = new ( sizeof(char) * (length+1) );
00124   copy = new char[length + 1];
00125   // strncpy is deprecated
00126   // strncpy(copy, s, length+1);
00127   memcpy(copy,s,length+1);
00128   return copy;
00129 }

00146 bool Util::stringEndsWith(const std::string& str,const std::string& end)
00147 {
00148   std::string::const_reverse_iterator s_i=str.rbegin();
00149   std::string::const_reverse_iterator s_end=str.rend();
00150   std::string::const_reverse_iterator e_i=end.rbegin();
00151   std::string::const_reverse_iterator e_end=end.rend();
00152 
00153   // see if the whole thing end is there.
00154   while (e_i!=e_end) {
00155     if ((s_i==s_end) ||   // ran out of input string
00156         ((*e_i)!=(*s_i)) // mismatch
00157         ) {
00158       return false; // didnt end with 'end'.
00159     }
00160     // advance (backwards!)
00161     e_i++;
00162     s_i++;
00163   }
00164   // 'end' was at the end of the string.
00165   return true;
00166 }
00167 
00168 bool Util::endsWithStr(const std::string& str,const std::string& ending,int charsAtEnd)
00169 {
00170   if (ending.size()>str.size()) {
00171     return false;
00172   }
00173   std::string tmpstr=str.substr(str.size()-(ending.size()+charsAtEnd),ending.size());
00174   return tmpstr==ending;
00175 }
00176 
00177 bool Util::endsWithStr(const std::string& str,const std::string& ending)
00178 {
00179   return endsWithStr(str,ending,0);
00180 }

00182 
00183 std::string Util::findLibFile(const std::string &fileName, const std::string &searchPath){
00184 
00185     if(fileName == "") {
00186         // empty string is not valid file name. just return it back
00187         return fileName;
00188     } else if(fileExists(fileName)) {
00189         // file exists as already specified
00190         return fileName;
00191     } else {
00192         // Now lets search for the file
00193         std::vector<std::string> searchPathVec;
00194         if(searchPath != "") {
00196             chopString(searchPath,':',searchPathVec);
00197         } else {
00198             char *sp = getenv("AFFX_ANALYSIS_FILES_PATH");
00199             if(sp == NULL) {
00200                 return fileName;
00201             } else {
00202                 chopString(sp,':',searchPathVec);
00203             }
00204         }
00205 
00206         for(int i=0; i< searchPathVec.size(); i++) {
00207             if(fileExists(searchPathVec[i] + PATH_SEPARATOR + fileName))
00208                 return searchPathVec[i] + PATH_SEPARATOR + fileName;
00209         }
00210     }
00211 
00212     // did not find anything, so just return what we started with
00213     return fileName;
00214 }

00222 void Util::mustOpenToWrite(std::ofstream &out, const std::string &fileName) {
00223   assert(fileName.c_str());
00224   out.open(fileName.c_str());
00225   if(!out.is_open() || !out.good()) {
00226     out.open(Util::convertPathName(fileName).c_str());
00227     if(!out.is_open() || !out.good()) {
00228         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + Util::convertPathName(fileName) + " to write.");
00229     }
00230   }
00231   // Set to throw an exception if something bad happens rather than silently fail.
00232   out.exceptions(ofstream::eofbit | ofstream::failbit | ofstream::badbit );
00233 }

00239 void Util::carefulClose(std::ofstream &out) {
00240   // If file is open, do some checks to make sure that it was successful...
00241   if(out.is_open()) {
00242     if(out.bad()) {
00243       Err::errAbort("Util::carefulClose() - ofstream bad.");
00244     }
00245   }
00246   out.close();
00247 }

00267 bool Util::fileReadable(const std::string &fileName) {
00268   int f;
00269   f = POSIX_OPEN(fileName.c_str(), O_RDONLY);
00270   if(f < 0) {
00271     f = POSIX_OPEN(Util::convertPathName(fileName).c_str(), O_RDONLY);
00272     if(f < 0) {
00273       return false;
00274     }
00275   }
00276   POSIX_CLOSE(f);
00277   return true;
00278 }

00284 bool Util::fileExists(const std::string &fileName) {
00286   // _stat() on windows does not handle "\\?\" style long names. One
00287   // suggestion was to use FindFirstFile() instead of _stat(). For now
00288   // we just return whether or not the file is readable on windows.
00289 #ifdef WIN32
00290   return Util::fileReadable(fileName);
00291 #else
00292   struct stat st;
00293   if(stat(fileName.c_str(), &st) == 0) {
00294     return true;
00295   } else {
00296     if(stat(Util::convertPathName(fileName).c_str(), &st) == 0) {
00297       return true;
00298     }
00299   } 
00300   return false;
00301 #endif
00302 }
00303 
00308 bool _uncheckedFileRemove(const std::string &fileName, int tries, int sec) {
00309     tries--;
00310     sec *= 3;
00311     bool success = true;
00312 #ifdef WIN32
00313     if (DeleteFile(fileName.c_str()) == false) {
00314         if (DeleteFile(Util::convertPathName(fileName).c_str()) == false) {
00315             success = false;
00316         }
00317     } 
00318 #else
00319     if (remove(fileName.c_str()) != 0)
00320         success = false;
00321 #endif
00322 
00323     // AGCC (and potentially other file indexers) may have a lock on the file. 
00324     // So retry a few times before giving up.
00325     if(success) {
00326         return success;
00327     } else if(tries > 0) {
00328         sleep(sec);
00329         return _uncheckedFileRemove(fileName, tries, sec);
00330     } else {
00331         return false;
00332     }
00333 }
00334 
00339 bool Util::fileRemove(const std::string &fileName, bool throwOnError) {
00340     bool success = true;
00341     if(fileExists(fileName)) {
00342         success = _uncheckedFileRemove(fileName, 4, 10);
00343     }
00344     if(throwOnError && !success)
00345         Err::errAbort("Unable to remove file: '" + fileName + "'");
00346     return success;
00347 }
00348 
00349 void Util::fileRemove(std::vector<std::string> &filesToRemove) {
00350     string errors = "Failed to remove files: ";
00351     bool error = false;
00352     for (int chip=0; chip < filesToRemove.size(); chip++) {
00353         if(!Util::fileRemove(filesToRemove[chip].c_str())) {
00354             error = true;
00355             errors += filesToRemove[chip] + ", ";
00356         }
00357     }
00358     if(error) {
00359         Err::errAbort(errors);
00360     }
00361 }

00364 bool Util::dirRemove(const std::string& dirname, bool throwOnError)
00365 {
00366   bool success=true;
00367 
00368 #ifdef WIN32
00369   if (RemoveDirectory(dirname.c_str())==false) {
00370     if (RemoveDirectory(Util::convertPathName(dirname).c_str())==false) {
00371         success=false;
00372     }
00373   }
00374 #else
00375   int rv;
00376   rv=rmdir(dirname.c_str());
00377   if (rv!=0) {
00378     success=false;
00379   }
00380 #endif
00381 
00382   if(throwOnError && !success) {
00383     Err::errAbort("Unable to remove dir: '" + dirname + "'");
00384   }
00385   return success;
00386 }

00393 bool Util::fileCopy(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, bool throwOnError) {
00395   bool success = true;
00396 
00397   std::ifstream is;
00398   std::ofstream os;
00399   std::string iName = in;
00400   std::string oName = out;
00401 
00402   is.open(in.c_str(), ios::binary);
00403   if(!is.is_open() || !is.good()) {
00404     iName = Util::convertPathName(in);
00405     is.open(iName.c_str(),ios::binary);
00406   }
00407 
00408   os.open(out.c_str(), ios::binary);
00409   if(!os.is_open() || !os.good()) {
00410     oName = Util::convertPathName(out);
00411     is.open(oName.c_str(),ios::binary);
00412   }
00413 
00414   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
00415       success = false;
00416 
00417   os << is.rdbuf();
00418   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
00419       success = false;
00420 
00421   is.close();
00422   os.close();
00423   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
00424       success = false;
00425 
00426   if(throwOnError && !success)
00427       Err::errAbort("Unable to copy file '" + iName + "' to '" + oName + "'");
00428   return success;
00429 }

00435 bool _uncheckedFileRename(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, int tries, int sec) {
00436     tries--;
00437     sec *= 3;
00438     bool success = true;
00439 #ifdef WIN32
00440     success = (MoveFile(in.c_str(), out.c_str()) == TRUE);
00441     if(!success) {
00442         success = (MoveFile(Util::convertPathName(in).c_str(), Util::convertPathName(out).c_str()) == TRUE);
00443     }
00444 #else
00445     success = (rename(in.c_str(), out.c_str()) == 0);
00446 #endif
00447     if(success) {
00448         return success;
00449     } else if(tries > 0) {
00450         sleep(sec);
00451         return _uncheckedFileRename(in, out, tries, sec);
00452     } else {
00453         return false;
00454     }
00455 }
00461 bool Util::fileRename(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, bool throwOnError) {
00462     bool success = true;
00463     _uncheckedFileRename(in,out,4,10);
00464   if(throwOnError && !success)
00465       Err::errAbort("Unable to rename file '" + in + "' to '" + out + "'");
00466   return success;
00467 }

00474 void Util::chompLastIfSep(std::string &s) {
00475     string::size_type i = s.rfind(PATH_SEPARATOR);
00476     if(i != string::npos && i == s.length() -1)
00477         s.erase(i);
00478 }

00485 std::string Util::chopSuffix(const std::string& s, char d) {
00486   string::size_type pos = s.rfind(d);
00487   if(pos != string::npos) {
00488     return s.substr(0,pos);
00489   }
00490   return s;
00491 }
00492 
00493 #ifdef WIN32
00494 // Windows doesn't seem to have these defined, so we'll define them 
00495 // here for utility. Note that with the windows _stat() function all
00496 // users have id 0 and group 0.
00497 #ifndef __MINGW32__
00498 #define S_IRUSR 00400 //owner has read permission
00499 #define  S_IWUSR 00200 //owner has write permission
00500 #define S_IXUSR 00100 
00501 #endif
00502 #define S_IRWXG 00070 //mask for group permissions
00503 #define  S_IRGRP 00040 //group has read permission
00504 #define  S_IWGRP 00020 //group has write permission
00505 #define S_IXGRP 00010 //group has execute permission
00506 #define  S_IRWXO 00007 //mask for permissions for others (not in group)
00507 #define  S_IROTH 00004 //others have read permission
00508 #define S_IWOTH 00002 //others have write permisson
00509 #define S_IXOTH 00001 // others have execute permission
00510 #endif
00511 
00515 bool Util::directoryReadable(const std::string &dirName) {
00516   std::string dirString=dirName;
00517   chompLastIfSep(dirString); // Windows doesn't like the trailing '\'
00518   struct stat s;
00519   int val = 0;
00520 #ifdef WIN32
00521   int group = 0;
00522   int user = 0;
00523 #else
00524   gid_t group = getgid();
00525   uid_t user = getuid();
00526 #endif
00527   bool readable = false;
00529   val = stat( dirString.c_str() , &s);
00530   /* if it doesn't exist or isn't readable, can't read it. */
00531   if(!S_ISDIR(s.st_mode) || val != 0) {
00532     return false;
00533   }
00534   /* If user owns directory and user readable then we can read it. */
00535   if(user == s.st_uid) {
00536     readable = (S_IRUSR & s.st_mode) && (S_IXUSR & s.st_mode);
00537   }
00538   /* if group owns directory and it is user readable then we can read it. */
00539   else if(group == s.st_gid) {
00540     readable = (S_IRGRP & s.st_mode) && (S_IXGRP & s.st_mode);
00541   }
00542   /* if anybody can read directory then we can too. */
00543   else if((S_IROTH & s.st_mode) && (S_IXOTH & s.st_mode)) {
00544     readable = true;
00545   }
00546   return readable;
00547 }
00548 
00553 bool Util::directoryWritable(const std::string &dirname) {
00554   std::string dirname_tmp;
00555   struct stat s;
00556   bool writable = false;
00557 
00558 #ifdef WIN32
00559   int group = 0;
00560   int user = 0;
00561 #else
00562   gid_t group = getgid();
00563   uid_t user = getuid();
00564 #endif
00565 
00566   // we dont want the trailing slash.
00567   dirname_tmp=dirname;
00568   chompLastIfSep(dirname_tmp);
00569 
00571   int rv = stat(dirname_tmp.c_str(), &s);
00572 
00573   /* Cant write if not found. */
00574   if (rv!=0) {
00575     return false;
00576   }
00577   /* If it isn't a directory we can't write to it... */
00578   if (!S_ISDIR(s.st_mode)) {
00579     return false;
00580   }
00581   /* If user owns directory and user writeable then we can write it. */
00582   if (user == s.st_uid) {  
00583       writable = (S_IWUSR & s.st_mode) && (S_IXUSR & s.st_mode);
00584   }
00585   /* if group owns directory and it is user writeable then we can write it. */
00586   else if (group == s.st_gid) {
00587     writable = (S_IWGRP & s.st_mode) && (S_IXGRP & s.st_mode);
00588   }
00589   /* if anybody can write directory then we can too. */
00590   else if((S_IWOTH & s.st_mode) && (S_IXOTH & s.st_mode)) {
00591       writable = true;
00592   }
00593   //
00594   return writable;
00595 }
00596 
00604 bool Util::makeDir(const std::string &dirName) {
00605   int error;
00606 
00608 
00609   // Need to trim off trailing slash (or backslash)
00610   std::string tmpDirName=dirName;
00611   if (tmpDirName.rfind("/")==(tmpDirName.size()-1)) {
00612     tmpDirName.erase(tmpDirName.size()-1);
00613   }
00614   else if (tmpDirName.rfind("\\")==(tmpDirName.size()-1)) {
00615     tmpDirName.erase(tmpDirName.size()-1);
00616   }
00617 
00618 #ifdef WIN32
00619   error = POSIX_MKDIR(tmpDirName.c_str());
00620 #else
00621   error = POSIX_MKDIR(tmpDirName.c_str(), 0777);
00622 #endif
00623   
00624   if (error==0) {
00625     return true; // we made it
00626   }
00627   else {
00628     if ((errno==EEXIST)&&directoryWritable(tmpDirName)) {
00629       return false; // we didnt make it but it exists and is writeable.
00630     }
00631   }
00632   // opps! Not there or not writeable.
00633   Err::errAbort("Error: Util::makeDir() - failed to make directory '"+tmpDirName+"'");
00634   // to keep gcc happy.
00635   return true;
00636 }
00637 
00638 bool Util::makeDirPath(const std::string& pathName)
00639 {
00640   std::vector<std::string> parts;
00641   chopString(pathName,'/',parts);
00642   
00643   std::string path;
00644 
00645   for (int i=0;i<parts.size();i++) {
00646     path+=parts[i];
00647     if (directoryReadable(path)) {
00648       continue;
00649     }
00650     // this will call errAbort
00651     makeDir(path);
00652   }
00653   return true;
00654 }
00655 
00663 void Util::chopString(const std::string& s,const char delim,std::vector<std::string>& words) {
00664   string::size_type len = 0, start = 0, next = 0;
00665   words.clear();
00666   len = s.length();
00667 
00668   while(start < len) {
00669     next = s.find(delim, start);
00670     if(next == string::npos) {
00671       next = s.size(); // entire string.
00672     }
00673     words.push_back(s.substr(start, next - start));
00674     start = next+1;
00675   }
00676 }

00691 std::vector<std::string> Util::fileRoot(const std::vector<std::string>& filename_vec)

00694   for (int i=0;i<filename_vec.size();i++) {
00695     rootname_vec.push_back(AffxFile::parseFileName(filename_vec[i]));
00696   }
00697   return rootname_vec;
00698 }
00699 
00716 int Util::matrixDifferences(const std::string& targetFile,
00717                             const std::string& queryFile, 
00718                             int colSkip, int rowSkip, double epsilon, bool printMismatch,
00719                             bool matchRows) {
00720 
00722 
00723   vector< vector<double> > qMatrix, tMatrix;
00724   unsigned int rowIx = 0, colIx = 0;
00725   unsigned int numCol = 0, numRow = 0;
00726   bool same = true;
00727   map<string, int> qMatrixMap;
00728   vector<string> qMatrixRows, tMatrixRows;
00729   unsigned int diffCount = 0;
00730   unsigned int rowDiffCount = 0;
00731   double maxDiff = 0;
00732   Verbose::out(2, "Reading in file: " + ToStr(targetFile));
00733   RowFile::matrixFromFile(targetFile, qMatrix, rowSkip, colSkip);
00734   Verbose::out(2, "Reading in file: " + ToStr(queryFile));
00735   RowFile::matrixFromFile(queryFile, tMatrix, rowSkip, colSkip);
00736 
00737   /* If we are matching by rows grab the first column from each file
00738      and assume it is the unique row names. Create a map from the 
00739      names to the indexes for qMatrix */
00740   if(matchRows) {
00741     colIx = 0;
00742     Verbose::out(2, "Reading in rownames.");
00743     TableFile::columnFromFile(targetFile, qMatrixRows, colIx, rowSkip, true);
00744     TableFile::columnFromFile(queryFile, tMatrixRows, colIx, rowSkip, true);
00745     for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < qMatrixRows.size(); rowIx++) {
00746       if(qMatrixMap.find(qMatrixRows[rowIx]) != qMatrixMap.end()) {
00747         Err::errAbort("Duplicate row names: " + qMatrixRows[rowIx] + " in matrix 1");
00748       }
00749       qMatrixMap[qMatrixRows[rowIx]] = rowIx;
00750     }
00751   }
00752   
00753   Verbose::out(2,"Looking for differences.");
00754   if((!matchRows && qMatrix.size() != tMatrix.size()) || qMatrix[0].size() != tMatrix[0].size()) {
00755     Err::errAbort("Matrices are different sizes, not comparable.");
00756   }
00757   numRow = tMatrix.size();
00758   numCol = tMatrix[0].size();
00759 
00760   for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < numRow; rowIx++) {
00761     bool rowDiff = false;
00762     for(colIx = 0; colIx < numCol; colIx++) {
00763       int qMatRowIx = rowIx;
00764       /* If doing match rows, look up the correct row based on row name. */
00765       if(matchRows) {
00766         if(qMatrixMap.find(tMatrixRows[rowIx]) == qMatrixMap.end() )
00767           Err::errAbort("Can't find rowname: " + tMatrixRows[rowIx] + " in matrix 1");
00768         else 
00769           qMatRowIx = qMatrixMap[tMatrixRows[rowIx]];
00770       }
00771       double val = qMatrix[qMatRowIx][colIx] - tMatrix[rowIx][colIx];
00772       maxDiff = max(maxDiff, fabs(val));
00773       bool failed = (fabs(val) > epsilon);
00774       bool okFinite = true;
00775       okFinite &= isFinite(qMatrix[qMatRowIx][colIx]);
00776       okFinite &= isFinite(tMatrix[rowIx][colIx]);
00777       if(!okFinite) 
00778         Verbose::out(1, "Non-finite floating point numbers at row: " + ToStr(rowIx) + " column: " + ToStr(colIx));
00779       if(failed || !okFinite) {
00780         same = false;
00781         rowDiff = true;
00782         diffCount++;
00783         if(printMismatch) {
00784           Verbose::out(1, "row: " + ToStr(rowIx) + " col: " + ToStr(colIx) + " (" +
00785                        ToStr(qMatrix[qMatRowIx][colIx]) + " vs. " + ToStr( tMatrix[rowIx][colIx]) + ")" + " Diff: " + ToStr(val));
00786         }
00787       }
00788     }
00789     if(rowDiff)
00790       rowDiffCount++;
00791   }
00792   if(maxDiff > 0) {
00793     Verbose::out(2, "Max difference is: " + ToStr(maxDiff));
00794   }
00795   if(same) 
00796     Verbose::out(2,"Same.");
00797   else {
00798     unsigned int total = numRow * numCol;
00799     float percent = (float) rowDiffCount / numRow * 100;
00800     Verbose::out(2, "Different in " + ToStr(rowDiffCount) + " of " + ToStr(numRow) + " ( " + ToStr(percent) + "% )  entries.");
00801     percent = (float) diffCount / total * 100;
00802     Verbose::out(2, "Different at " + ToStr(diffCount) + " of " + ToStr(total) + " ( " + ToStr(percent) + "% )  entries.");
00803   }
00804   return diffCount;
00805 }
00806 
00807 /* Private method to this file used to convert a relative path
00808    into an absolute path, and if successful to add "\\?\"
00809    prefix. This prevents the system APIs for failing on long
00810    filenames/paths by forcing them to pass the filename
00811    directly down into the low level file system APIs. */
00812 #if defined (WIN32)
00813 std::string _getFullPathWindows(const std::string &in) {
00814     DWORD  retval=1;
00815     wchar_t  *wbuffer = new wchar_t[BUFFSIZE];  // Wide Char buffer for input path
00816     wchar_t  *buffer = new wchar_t[BUFFSIZE];   // Wide Char buffer for output absolute path
00817     char   *abuffer = new char[BUFFSIZE];       // Asci Char buffer for output absolute path
00818     uint32_t strLen = 0;
00819 
00820     // Setup wbuffer with our input
00821     const char *inPtr = in.c_str();
00822     strLen = strlen(inPtr);
00823     if(strLen > BUFFSIZE - 1) {
00824         Err::errAbort("Cannot handle string longer than " + ToStr(BUFFSIZE) + ": '" + 
00825                 in + "' is " + ToStr(strLen));
00826     }
00827     mbstowcs(wbuffer,inPtr, strLen + 1);
00828 
00829     // Compute the absolute path. We use the wide char
00830     // version which can handle > MAX_PATH
00831     retval = GetFullPathNameW(wbuffer,BUFFSIZE - 1,buffer,NULL);
00832 
00833     // If no characters were converted, then simply return the original string
00834     if (retval < 1) {
00835         Freez(wbuffer);
00836         Freez(buffer);
00837         Freez(abuffer);
00838         return in;
00839     }
00840 
00841     // If we will overflow our buffer, then abort.
00842     if(retval > BUFFSIZE-1) {
00843         Err::errAbort("Unexpected failure. Converted more characters than expected");
00844     }
00845 
00846     // Convert the absolute path to asci char from wide char
00847     wcstombs(abuffer, (wchar_t *)buffer, retval + 1);
00848 
00849     // Free up memory and return our string
00850     string rs;
00851     rs = abuffer;
00852     Freez(wbuffer);
00853     Freez(buffer);
00854     Freez(abuffer);
00855     if(rs == "") {
00856         // If our result is empty, return input string
00857         return in;
00858     } else {
00859         // Otherwise we have an absolute path, so add the "\\?\" magic
00860         if(rs == "") {
00861             return in;
00862         } else {
00863             if(rs.substr(0,2) == "\\\\")
00864                 return rs;
00865             else
00866                 return "\\\\?\\" + rs;
00867         }
00868     }
00869 }
00870 #endif
00871 
00887 std::string Util::convertPathName(const std::string &path, bool singleFile) {
00888   std::string s = path;
00889   if(s.find(':') != std::string::npos)
00890       return s;
00891 
00892 #if defined (WIN32)
00893   // Convert forward slash to back slash -- 92 is the ascii code for '\'
00894   subChar(s, '/', 92);
00895   // If we are given a single file name, then try and cope with extra long names
00896   // by using '\\?\C:\...\' magic
00897   if(singleFile) {
00898     // First we split into a path and filename parts
00899     size_t pos=s.rfind("\\");
00900     string pathPart, filePart;
00901     if(pos != std::string::npos) {
00902         pathPart = s.substr(0,pos);
00903         filePart = s.substr(pos+1);
00904     } else {
00905         // No path part found, so assume CWD
00906         pathPart = ".";
00907         filePart = s;
00908     }
00909     //Verbose::out(1,"Path Part = '" + pathPart + "'");
00910     //Verbose::out(1,"File Part = '" + filePart + "'");
00911     // Now we call this method to convert the minimal path part to
00912     // an absolute path. _getFullPathWindows() will add the
00913     // "\\?\" magic if appropriate.
00914     pathPart = _getFullPathWindows(pathPart);
00915     s = pathPart + PATH_SEPARATOR + filePart;
00916   }
00917 #else
00918   // Unix deals with long filenames/paths as one would expect.
00919   // So all we need to do is flip back slashes to forward slashes.
00920   // 92 is the ascii code for '\'
00921   subChar(s, 92, '/');
00922 #endif
00923   //Verbose::out(1, "Converted '" + path + "' to '" + s + "'");
00924   return s;
00925 }
00926 
00927 
00932 int32_t Util::schrageRandom(int32_t *ix) {
00933   int32_t a = 16807, p = 2147483647, xhi = 0, xlo = 0;
00934   int32_t rand = 0;
00935   int32_t r = p % a;
00936   int32_t q = p / a;
00937   Err::check(*ix > 0, "Error: Util::schrageRandom() - Cannot seed with 0");
00938   /* Break into high and low bits to avoid overflow. */
00939   xhi = (*ix) / q;
00940   xlo = (*ix)  - xhi*q;
00941   /* Combine high and low. */
00942   (*ix) = a * xlo - r * xhi;
00943   if((*ix) < 0) {
00944     (*ix) = (*ix) + p;
00945   }
00946   rand = (*ix); 
00947   return rand;
00948 }
00949 
00950 std::string Util::asMB(uint64_t x) {
00951   return ToStr(x/MEGABYTE) + "MB";
00952 }
00953 
00954 #ifdef WIN32 
00955 #define memInfo_defined 1
00962 bool memInfo_win32(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
00963                    uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
00964 {
00965   MEMORYSTATUSEX statex;
00966   statex.dwLength = sizeof(statex);
00967   if(GlobalMemoryStatusEx(&statex) == 0) {
00968     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Could not determine memory usage with: GlobalMemoryStatusEx().");
00969   }
00970   free = statex.ullAvailPhys;
00971   total = statex.ullTotalPhys;
00972   swapAvail = statex.ullAvailVirtual - statex.ullAvailPhys;
00973   memAvail = (uint64_t)(free * 0.90);
00974 
00975   return true;
00976 }
00977 #endif
00978   
00979 #ifdef __linux__
00980 #define memInfo_defined 1
00981 
00989 bool memInfo_linux(std::string proc_meminfo_filename,
00990                    uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
00991                    uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
00992 {
00993   std::ifstream proc_meminfo;
00994   std::string key;
00995   std::string line;
00996   //char line_buf[1024];
00997   //std::istringstream line_stm(line_buf,sizeof(line_buf));
00998   uint64_t val;
00999   std::string units;
01000   uint64_t buffersUsed=0, cached=0;
01001   
01002   free=total=swapAvail=memAvail=0;
01003 
01004   // 2.4
01005   // total: used: free: shared: buffers: cached:
01006   // Mem:  4097478656 2765283328 1332195328 0 219951104 2328576000
01007   // Swap: 3224301568        0 3224301568
01008 
01009   // 2.6
01010   // MemTotal:      4059404 kB
01011   // MemFree:       2169240 kB
01012   // Buffers:         33776 kB
01013   // Cached:        1618328 kB
01014 
01015   proc_meminfo.open(proc_meminfo_filename.c_str());
01016   while (!proc_meminfo.eof()) {
01017     getline(proc_meminfo,line);
01018     //cout<<"L: "<<line<<"\n";
01019     std::istringstream line_stm(line);
01020     
01021     //proc_meminfo.getline(line_buf,sizeof(line_buf));
01022     //line_stm.seekg(0,ios_base::beg);
01023     //cout << line_stm;
01024     key="";
01025     val=0;
01026     units="";
01027     // MemTotal:      4059404 kB
01028     line_stm >> key;
01029     line_stm >> val;
01030     line_stm >> units;
01031 
01032     // Handle the linux-2.4 case.
01033     if (key=="total:") {
01034       std::string ignore;
01035       std::string line_mem;
01036       getline(proc_meminfo,line_mem);
01037       std::istringstream line_stm_24_mem(line_mem);
01038       line_stm_24_mem >> key;
01039       line_stm_24_mem >> total;       // total:
01040       line_stm_24_mem >> ignore;      // used:
01041       line_stm_24_mem >> free;        // free:
01042       line_stm_24_mem >> ignore;      // shared:
01043       line_stm_24_mem >> buffersUsed; // buffers:
01044       //
01045       std::string line_swap;
01046       getline(proc_meminfo,line_swap);
01047       std::istringstream line_stm_24_swap(line_swap);
01048       line_stm_24_swap >> ignore;      // Swap:
01049       line_stm_24_swap >> swapAvail;
01050       // we dont need any more data
01051       break;
01052     }
01053     //
01054     //printf("%-20s=%10lu %4s\n",key.c_str(),val,units.c_str());
01055     //
01056     if (units=="kB") {
01057       val=val*1024;
01058     } 
01059     else if (units=="MB") {
01060       val=val*1024*1024;
01061     } else {
01062       // just give up if the units arent there.
01063       break;
01064       // assert(0);
01065     }
01066     //
01067     if (key=="MemTotal:") {
01068       total=val;
01069     }
01070     else if (key=="MemFree:") {
01071       free=val;
01072     }
01073     else if (key=="SwapFree:") {
01074       swapAvail=val;
01075     }
01076     else if (key=="Buffers:") {
01077       buffersUsed=val;
01078     }
01079     else if (key=="Cached:") {
01080       cached=val;
01081     } 
01082   }
01083   proc_meminfo.close();
01084   
01085   memAvail=(uint64_t)(free+0.90*buffersUsed+cached);
01086   
01087   return true;
01088 }
01089 #endif
01090 
01091 #ifdef __APPLE__
01092 #define memInfo_defined 1
01099 bool memInfo_darwin(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
01100                     uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
01101 {
01102   // ask mach 
01103   struct vm_statistics vm_stat;
01104   vm_size_t   my_pagesize;
01105   mach_port_t my_host=mach_host_self();
01106   mach_msg_type_number_t count = HOST_VM_INFO_COUNT;
01107   
01108   if (host_page_size(my_host,&my_pagesize)!=KERN_SUCCESS) {
01109     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Didnt succeed with 'host_page_size'.");
01110   }
01111   if (host_statistics(my_host, HOST_VM_INFO,(integer_t*)&vm_stat,&count) != KERN_SUCCESS) {
01112     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Didnt succeed with 'host_statistics'.");
01113   }
01114   
01115   // there isnt a total in the struct; sum it up.
01116   total=(vm_stat.free_count+vm_stat.active_count+vm_stat.inactive_count+vm_stat.wire_count);
01117   // THEN multiply by the page size.  (a 64b multiply)
01118   total=total*my_pagesize;
01119   
01120 //#define PRINT_IT(x) printf("%-30s: %8d\n",#x,x)
01121 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.free_count);
01122 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.active_count);
01123 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.inactive_count);
01124 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.wire_count);
01125 
01126   // should we add in vm_stat.inactive_count?
01127   free=vm_stat.free_count;
01128   free=free*my_pagesize;
01129   // darwin can use all the disk space -- report zero
01130   swapAvail=0;
01131   // our guess as to what we can allocate
01132   memAvail=(uint64_t)(0.90*(vm_stat.free_count+vm_stat.inactive_count)*my_pagesize);
01133   
01134   return true;
01135 }
01136 #endif
01137 
01138 #ifdef __sun__
01139 #define memInfo_defined 1
01146 bool memInfo_solaris(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
01147                      uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
01148 {
01149   uint64_t page_size=sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE);
01150 
01151   free  =sysconf(_SC_AVPHYS_PAGES)*page_size;
01152   total =sysconf(_SC_PHYS_PAGES  )*page_size;
01153   // figure we can use a quarter of the allocated memory
01154   memAvail=free+((total-free)/4);
01155   // dont want to call swapctl...
01156   swapAvail=0;
01157 
01158   return true;
01159 }
01160 #endif
01161 
01162 #ifdef __which_system_was_this_for__
01163 #define memInfo_defined 1
01170 bool memInfo_sysinfo(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
01171                      uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
01172 {
01173   struct sysinfo info;
01174   if(sysinfo(&info) != 0) {
01175     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Could not determine memory usage with: sysinfo().");
01176   }
01177   free = info.freeram * info.mem_unit;
01178   total = info.totalram * info.mem_unit;
01179   swapAvail = info.freeswap * info.mem_unit;
01180   // We use this as a guesstimate of how much ram we can safely allocate on the system.
01181   // The factor of 0.90 is to leave a bit of memory for other users.
01182   memAvail=(uint64_t)(free+0.90*(info.bufferram*info.mem_unit));
01183 
01184   return true;
01185 }
01186 #endif
01187 
01199 bool Util::memInfo(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total, 
01200                    uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail, 
01201                    bool cap32bit) {
01202   bool success = false;
01203   bool is32bit = true;
01204   free=total=swapAvail=memAvail=0;
01205 
01206   // One of these should be defined.
01208 #ifdef WIN32
01209 #ifdef _WIN64
01210   is32bit = false;
01211 #else
01212   is32bit = true;
01213 #endif
01214   success=memInfo_win32(free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
01215 #endif //WIN32
01216 
01217 #ifdef __linux__
01218 #ifdef __LP64__
01219   is32bit = false;
01220 #else
01221   is32bit = true;
01222 #endif
01223   success=memInfo_linux("/proc/meminfo",free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
01224 #endif //__linux__
01225 
01226 #ifdef __APPLE__
01227 #ifdef __LP64__
01228   is32bit = false;
01229 #else
01230   is32bit = true;
01231 #endif
01232   success=memInfo_darwin(free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
01233 #endif //__APPLE__
01234 
01235 #ifdef __sun__
01236   success=memInfo_solaris(free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
01237 #endif // __sun__
01238 
01239   if (memAvail>MEMINFO_2GB_MAX && (is32bit || cap32bit)) {
01240     memAvail=MEMINFO_2GB_MAX;
01241   }
01242 
01243   return success;
01244 }

01246 #ifdef WIN32
01247 static int64_t getAvailableDiskSpace_win32(const std::string& path) {
01248     ULARGE_INTEGER lpFreeBytesAvailable;
01249     ULARGE_INTEGER lpTotalNumberOfBytes;
01250     ULARGE_INTEGER lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes;
01251 
01252     if (!GetDiskFreeSpaceEx(
01253                             path.c_str(),
01254                             &lpFreeBytesAvailable,
01255                             &lpTotalNumberOfBytes,
01256                             &lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes
01257     )){
01258         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::getAvailableDiskSpace() - Could not determine available disk space with GetDiskFreeSpaceEx().");
01259         return -1;
01260     }
01261 
01262     return lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes.QuadPart;
01263 }
01264 #endif
01265 
01266 #ifdef __linux__
01267 static int64_t getAvailableDiskSpace_linux(const std::string& path) {
01268     struct statfs retBuf;
01269     if(statfs(path.c_str(), &retBuf)) {
01270         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::getAvailableDiskSpace() - Could not determine available disk space with statfs().");
01271         return -1;
01272     }
01273     return int64_t(retBuf.f_bavail) * int64_t(retBuf.f_bsize);
01274 }
01275 #endif
01276 
01277 #ifdef __APPLE__
01278 static int64_t getAvailableDiskSpace_mac(const std::string& path) {
01279     struct statfs retBuf;
01280     if(statfs(path.c_str(), &retBuf)) {
01281         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::getAvailableDiskSpace() - Could not determine available disk space with statfs().");
01282         return -1;
01283     }
01284     return int64_t(retBuf.f_bavail) * int64_t(retBuf.f_bsize);
01285 }
01286 #endif
01287 
01295 int64_t Util::getAvailableDiskSpace(const std::string& path) {
01296 #ifdef WIN32
01297     return getAvailableDiskSpace_win32(path);
01298 #endif
01299 
01300 #ifdef __linux__
01301     return getAvailableDiskSpace_linux(path);
01302 #endif
01303 
01304 #ifdef __APPLE__
01305     return getAvailableDiskSpace_mac(path);
01306 #endif
01307 
01308     return -1;
01309 }

01311 #ifdef WIN32
01312 static int64_t isSameVolume_win32(const std::string& path1, const std::string& path2) {
01313     TCHAR volumeNameBuffer1[MAX_PATH+1];
01314     if(!GetVolumePathName(
01315                             path1.c_str(),
01316                             volumeNameBuffer1,
01317                             MAX_PATH+1
01318     )){
01319         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::isSameVolume() - Could not determine volume path name(1) with GetVolumePathName().");
01320         return -1;
01321     }
01322     TCHAR volumeNameBuffer2[MAX_PATH+1];
01323     if(!GetVolumePathName(
01324                             path2.c_str(),
01325                             volumeNameBuffer2,
01326                             MAX_PATH+1
01327     )){
01328         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::isSameVolume() - Could not determine volume path name(2) with GetVolumePathName().");
01329         return -1;
01330     }
01331     if (_stricmp(volumeNameBuffer1, volumeNameBuffer2) == 0)
01332         return 1;
01333 
01334     return 0;
01335 }
01336 #endif
01337 
01338 #ifdef __linux__
01339 static int64_t isSameVolume_linux(const std::string& path1, const std::string& path2) {
01340     struct stat retBuf1, retBuf2;
01341     if (stat(path1.c_str(), &retBuf1)) {
01342         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::isSameVolume() - Could not determine volume path name(1) with stat().");
01343         return -1;
01344     }
01345     if (stat(path2.c_str(), &retBuf2)) {
01346         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::isSameVolume() - Could not determine volume path name(2) with stat().");
01347         return -1;
01348     }
01349     if (retBuf1.st_dev == retBuf2.st_dev)
01350         return 1;
01351 
01352     return 0;
01353 }
01354 #endif
01355 
01356 #ifdef __APPLE__
01357 static int64_t isSameVolume_mac(const std::string& path1, const std::string& path2) {
01358     struct stat retBuf1, retBuf2;
01359     if (stat(path1.c_str(), &retBuf1)) {
01360         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::isSameVolume() - Could not determine volume path name(1) with stat().");
01361         return -1;
01362     }
01363     if (stat(path2.c_str(), &retBuf2)) {
01364         Verbose::warn(1, "Util::isSameVolume() - Could not determine volume path name(2) with stat().");
01365         return -1;
01366     }
01367     if (retBuf1.st_dev == retBuf2.st_dev)
01368         return 1;
01369 
01370     return 0;
01371 }
01372 #endif
01373 
01382 int64_t Util::isSameVolume(const std::string& path1, const std::string& path2) {
01383 
01384 #ifdef WIN32
01385     return isSameVolume_win32(path1, path2);
01386 #endif
01387 
01388 #ifdef __linux__
01389     return isSameVolume_linux(path1, path2);
01390 #endif
01391 
01392 #ifdef __APPLE__
01393     return isSameVolume_mac(path1, path2);
01394 #endif
01395 
01396     return -1;
01397 }

01399 
01407 const char *Util::nextWhiteSpace(const char *s) {
01408   while(s[0] != '\0' && !isspace(s[0])) {
01409     s++;
01410   }
01411   return s;
01412 }
01413 
01424 void Util::printStringWidth(std::ostream &out,const std::string& str,
01425                             int prefix,
01426                             int currentPos, int maxWidth ) {
01427   const char *wStart = NULL, *wEnd = NULL; /* Start and end of word pointers. */
01428   int position = currentPos;
01429   int nextSize = 0;
01430   int i = 0;
01431   wStart = str.c_str();
01432 
01433   /* While there are still characters to be printed. */
01434   while(*wStart != '\0') {
01435     
01436     /* Clean out any whitespace. */
01437     while(isspace(*wStart) && *wStart != '\0') {
01438       if(*wStart == '\n') {
01439         out.put('\n');
01440         for(i = 0; i < prefix; i++) 
01441           out.put(' ');
01442         fflush(stdout);
01443         position = prefix;
01444       }
01445       *wStart++;
01446     }
01447 
01448     if(*wStart == '\0')
01449       break;
01450 
01451     /* Find the end of current word. */
01452     wEnd = wStart;
01453     while(!isspace(*wEnd) && *wEnd != '\0')
01454       wEnd++;
01455     
01456     /* Time for a newline? */
01457     if((wEnd - wStart) + position >= maxWidth) {
01458       out.put('\n');
01459       for(i = 0; i < prefix; i++) 
01460          out.put(' ');      
01461       position = prefix;
01462     }
01463     
01464     /* Print out the word. */
01465     while(wStart < wEnd) {
01466       out.put(*wStart);
01467       fflush(stdout);
01468       wStart++;
01469       position++;
01470     }
01471 
01472     /* Look to see where next word is. */
01473     while(isspace(*wEnd)) {
01474       if(*wEnd == '\n') {
01475         out.put('\n');
01476         for(i = 0; i < prefix; i++) 
01477             out.put(' ');      
01478         position = prefix;
01479       }
01480       wEnd++;
01481     }
01482      
01483     /* Figure out the size of the next word. */
01484     wStart = nextWhiteSpace(wEnd);
01485     if(wStart != NULL)
01486       nextSize = wStart - wEnd;
01487     else
01488       nextSize = 0;
01489 
01490     /* Print a space if we're not going to 
01491        print a newline. */
01492     if(wEnd != '\0' &&
01493        nextSize + position < maxWidth && 
01494        position != 0) {
01495       out.put(' ');
01496       position++;
01497     }
01498 
01499     wStart = wEnd;
01500   }
01501 }
01502 
01508 bool Util::isFinite(double x) {
01509   bool isOk = false;
01510 #ifdef WIN32
01511   isOk = _finite(x);
01512 #else
01513   isOk = finite(x);
01514 #endif 
01515   return isOk;
01516 }
01517 
01518 std::string Util::getTimeStamp() 
01519 {
01520   char *timeStr = NULL;
01521   struct tm *tp;
01522   time_t t = time(NULL);
01523   tp = localtime(&t);
01524   timeStr = asctime(tp); // timestamp prefix for log entries
01525   if(timeStr == NULL) {
01526     timeStr = "unknown";
01527   } else if(strlen(timeStr) < 24) {
01528     timeStr[strlen(timeStr) - 1] = '\0'; // knock off trailing '\n'
01529   } else {
01530     // we knock of to a fixed size as we've seen
01531     // trailing garbage if using strlen() suggesting
01532     // that there are times when the null term is not
01533     // where we expect it.
01534     timeStr[24] = '\0'; // knock off trailing '\n'
01535   }
01536   std::string timess = timeStr;
01537   return timess;
01538 }
01539 
01540 
01541 void Util::changeEnd(std::string& str,const std::string& from,const std::string& to)
01542 {
01543   size_t pos=str.rfind(from);
01544   if (pos!=string::npos) {
01545     str=str.substr(0,pos)+to;
01546   }
01547 }
01548 void Util::changeEnd(std::vector<std::string>& str_vec,const std::string& from,const std::string& to)
01549 {
01550   for (int i=0;i<str_vec.size();i++) {
01551     changeEnd(str_vec[i],from,to);
01552   }
01553 }

01556 //Assumes sentinel character (equal to NULL) exists at end of array
01557 std::vector<std::string> Util::listToVector(const char* in[])
01558 {
01559   std::vector<string> fullName;
01560 
01561   for (int i = 0; in[i] != NULL; i++)
01562   {
01563     fullName.push_back(in[i]);
01564   } 
01565   
01566   return fullName;
01567 }
01568 
01569 std::vector<std::string> Util::listToVector(const char* in[], int size)
01570 {
01571   std::vector<std::string> fullName;
01572 
01573   for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
01574     {
01575       fullName.push_back(in[i]);
01576     }
01577   
01578   return fullName;
01579 }

01581 std::vector<std::string> Util::addPrefixSuffix(std::vector<std::string> middle, 
01582                            const std::string &prefix, const std::string &suffix)
01583 {
01584   std::vector<std::string> fullName;
01585 
01586   for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator i = middle.begin(); i < middle.end();i++)
01587   {
01588      fullName.push_back(prefix + (*i) + suffix);
01589   }
01590 
01591   return fullName;
01592 }
01593 
01594 std::vector<std::string> Util::addPrefixSuffix(const char* middle[], 
01595                            const std::string &prefix, const std::string &suffix)
01596 {
01597   std::vector<std::string> fullName = addPrefixSuffix(listToVector(middle), prefix, suffix);
01598 
01599   return fullName;
01600 }

01603                            const std::string &prefix, const std::string &suffix)
01604 {

01660 std::string Util::joinVectorString(std::vector<std::string> toJoin, const std::string &sep)
01661 {
01662   std::string fullString="";
01663   
01664   for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator i = toJoin.begin(); i < toJoin.end();i++)
01665   {
01666     fullString += (*i)+sep;
01667   }
01668   return fullString;
01669 }

01691 void Util::pushMemFreeAtStart() {
01692     Util::StaticMem &mem = getStaticMem();
01693     uint64_t freeRam = 0, totalRam = 0, swapAvail = 0, memAvail = 0;
01694     Util::memInfo(freeRam, totalRam, swapAvail, memAvail, false);
01695     mem.pushMemFreeAtStart(memAvail);
01696 }
